name: Kiel Center for Eurasian Economic Law
goal: Our team members conduct research in different fields of international economic law, e.g. international investment law, law of the World Trade Organization, settlement of international economic disputes, and investment arbitration. We also focus on economic integration in the region of Central Asia and the Caucasus and on economic relations of the countries of this region with the European Union. We prepare, often in cooperation with colleagues from our partner universities, publications based on the results of our research.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Customs, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Trade, Transport
euInitiatives: We conduct research on economic cooperation of the EU with its partners within the Eastern Partnership Initiative. We also analyze recent developments in revising Partnership and Cooperation Agreements. Another field of research concerns the new competence of the EU regarding international investment agreements after the Lisbon Treaty.
